row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: Brian C. Moyer
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Brian C. Moyer

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: BEA paper develops new R&D time series

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Third Estimates for the Third Quarter of 2014
row.Author: Shelly Smith
row.Description: Real GDP increased 5.0 percent, reflecting positive contributions from consumer spending, nonresidential fixed investment, federal government spending, exports, state and local government spending, and residential fixed investment.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: U.S. Arts and Cultural Production Satellite Account, 1998–2012
row.Author: Paul V. Kern, David B. Wasshausen, Steven L. Zemanek
row.Description: The goal of this new economic account is to provide statistics that shed light on the impact of arts and cultural activities on the economy, including an estimate of the sector's contributions to gross domestic product.

row.Title: Introducing the New BEA Health Care Satellite Account
row.Author: Abe Dunn, Lindsey Rittmueller, Bryn Whitmire
row.Description: The first release of this economic account represents a milestone in BEA's efforts to develop health care statistics based on the treatment of diseases, thus allowing for a deeper understanding of this critical sector and its economic impact.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: U.S. International Transactions: Third Quarter of 2014
row.Author: Sarah P. Scott
row.Description: The current-account deficit increased $1.8 billion to $100.3 billion. In the financial account, net U.S. borrowing increased $0.3 billion to $22.5 billion.

row.Title: The U.S. Net International Investment Position at the End of the Third Quarter of 2014
row.Author: Elena L. Nguyen
row.Description: The position was –$6,157.9 billion at the end of the third quarter of 2014, down $682.5 billion from the end of the second quarter, reflecting a $362.4 billion decrease in the value of U.S. assets and a $320.2 billion increase in the value of U.S. liabilities.

row.Title: An Ownership-Based Framework of the U.S. Current Account for 2002–2013
row.Author: Thomas Anderson
row.Description: An annual supplement to the international transactions accounts presents current-account statistics that combine cross-bid trade with net receipts of affiliates of multinational enterprises.

row.Title: Regional Quarterly Report
row.Author: David G. Lenze
row.Description: In the third quarter of 2014, state personal income growth ranged from 1.4 percent in Texas to –0.2 percent in South Dakota. Growth slowed in California, Texas, Florida, and 35 smaller states.

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: Brian C. Moyer
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Brian C. Moyer

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: Better reconciliation of the U.S. economic accounts

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Advance Estimates for the Fourth Quarter of 2014
row.Author: Lisa S. Mataloni
row.Description: Real GDP increased 2.6 percent, reflecting positive contributions from consumer spending, inventory investment, exports, nonresidential fixed investment, state and local government spending, and residential fixed investment.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Q and A With BEA Director Brian C. Moyer
row.Description: Brian C. Moyer provides details on BEA's recent accomplishments and future plans.

row.Title: The Effects of Corporate Inversions on the International and National Economic Accounts
row.Author: Jessica M. Hanson, Howard I. Krakower, Raymond J. Mataloni Jr., Kate L.S. Pinard
row.Description: These inversions affect foreign direct investment in the United States and U.S. direct investment abroad as well as certain aggregates in the national income and product accounts.

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: Brian C. Moyer
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Brian C. Moyer

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: BEA paper estimates net value of health spending.

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Second Estimates for the Fourth Quarter of 2014
row.Author: Lisa S. Mataloni
row.Description: Real GDP increased 2.2 percent, reflecting positive contributions from consumer spending, nonresidential fixed investment, exports, state and local government spending, inventory investment, and residential fixed investment.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: NIPA Translation of the Fiscal Year 2016 Federal Budget
row.Author: Mark S. Ludwick, Benyam Tsehaye
row.Description: Once a year, BEA prepares federal government estimates that are based on the proposed budget of the U.S. government. This analysis is often used to gauge the effects of the federal budget on U.S. economic activity.
row.Category: National, NIPA translation of the federal budget

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: Brian C. Moyer
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Brian C. Moyer

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: Price indexes for Medicare Advantage enrollees

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Third Estimates for the Fourth Quarter of 2014
row.Author: Lisa S. Mataloni
row.Description: Real GDP increased 2.2 percent, reflecting positive contributions from consumer spending, nonresidential fixed investment, exports, state and local government spending, and residential fixed investment.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Government Receipts and Expenditures: Fourth Quarter of 2014
row.Author: Mary L. Roy
row.Description: Net government saving increased $54.1 billion to –$773.7 billion. Net federal government saving increased $51.5 billion to –$559.5 billion. Net state and local government saving increased $2.5 billion to –$214.3 billion.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Preview of the 2015 Annual Revision of the International Economic Accounts: Changes in Classifications and New Source Data
row.Author: Eric Bryda, C. Omar Kebbeh
row.Description: A look at the changes to the international transactions accounts and to the international investment position accounts that are planned as part of the upcoming revision.

row.Title: U.S. International Transactions: Fourth Quarter of 2014 and 2014
row.Author: William J. Zeile
row.Description: The current-account deficit increased $14.5 billion to $113.5 billion. In the financial account, net U.S. borrowing decreased $11.2 billion to $10.8 billion. In 2014, the current-account deficit increased $10.4 billion to $410.6 billion.

row.Title: The U.S. Net International Investment Position at the End of the Fourth Quarter of 2014 and 2014
row.Author: Kyle L. Westmoreland
row.Description: The net position was –$6,915.3 billion at the end of the fourth quarter of 2014, down $785.8 billion from the end of the third quarter. The decrease reflected a $76.1 billion increase in the value of U.S. assets and an $861.9 billion increase in the value of U.S. liabilities.

row.Title: Regional Quarterly Report
row.Author: David G. Lenze
row.Description: In the fourth quarter of 2014, state personal income growth picked up in Florida, Texas, and 30 other states. Growth ranged from 0.6 percent in Louisiana to 1.5 percent in Texas.

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: Brian C. Moyer
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Brian C. Moyer

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: Study looks at mortality rates and Medicare Part D

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Advance Estimates for the First Quarter of 2015
row.Author: Lisa S. Mataloni
row.Description: Real GDP increased 0.2 percent, compared with 2.2 percent in the fourth quarter of 2014; the slowdown reflected a slowdown in consumer spending and downturns in exports, in nonresidential fixed investment, and in state and local government spending.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: BEA Statistics and New Indicators of Economic Condition
row.Author: Benjamin R. Bridgman, Bruce T. Grimm
row.Description: This article explores potential new economic measures, created with BEA statistics, that can be used to analyze emerging imbalances in saving, investment, assets, liabilities, and other key variables.

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: Brian C. Moyer
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Brian C. Moyer

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: New experimental financial subsector estimates

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Second Estimates for the First Quarter of 2015
row.Author: Lisa S. Mataloni
row.Description: Real GDP decreased 0.7 percent, reflecting negative contributions from exports, nonresidential fixed investment, and state and local government spending. These were partly offset by positive contributions from consumer spending, inventory investment, and residential fixed investment.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Government Receipts and Expenditures: First Quarter of 2015
row.Author: Mary L. Roy
row.Description: Net government saving increased $58.8 billion to –$707.6 billion. Net federal government saving increased $46.5 billion to –$505.7 billion. Net state and local government saving increased $12.4 billion to –$201.9 billion.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Preview of the 2015 Annual Revision of the National Income and Product Accounts
row.Author: Stephanie H. McCulla, Shelly Smith
row.Description: Key changes include an improved treatment of federal refundable tax credits, the introduction of two new data series, improvements to seasonal adjustments to specific GDP components, and an expanded presentation of transfers and taxes between the United States and the rest of world.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: The National Income and Product Accounts and the System of National Accounts 2008
row.Author: Stephanie H. McCulla, Karin E. Moses, Brent R. Moulton
row.Description: A comparison of the NIPAs with the System of National Accounts 2008 and a look at BEA's plans for research on this topic.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Returns for Domestic Nonfinancial Business
row.Author: Robert J. Corea, Bonnie A. Retus
row.Description: Aggregate rates of return for nonfinancial corporations, industries, and selected industry groups as well as Q ratios. Domestic nonfinancial corporate returns decreased in 2014.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: U.S. Travel and Tourism Satellite Accounts for 1998–2014
row.Author: Benjamin J. Hobbs
row.Description: In 2014, travel and tourism increased 3.4 percent in 2014 after increasing 6.2 percent in 2013.
row.Category: Industry, Travel and tourism satellite accounts

row.Title: Subject Guide for January–June 2015
row.Description: A guide to the articles in these issues of the Survey.

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: Brian C. Moyer
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Brian C. Moyer

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: Brent Moulton wins 2015 Julius Shiskin Memorial Award for Economic Statistics

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Third Estimates for the First Quarter of 2015
row.Author: Lisa S. Mataloni
row.Description: Real GDP decreased 0.2 percent after increasing 2.2 percent in the fourth quarter of 2014. The decrease primarily reflected negative contributions from exports, business investment, and state and local government spending.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: The U.S. Net International Investment Position at the End of the First Quarter of 2015, Year 2014, and Annual Revisions
row.Author: Elena L. Nguyen
row.Description: The net international investment position was –$7,019.7 billion at the end of 2014, compared with –$5,327.5 billion at the end of 2013. At the end of the first quarter of 2015, the net position was –$6,794.0 billion.

row.Title: Direct Investment Positions for 2014: Country and Industry Detail
row.Author: Derrick T. Jenniges, James J. Fetzer
row.Description: The U.S. direct investment abroad position grew 4.8 percent after growing 6.4 percent in 2013. The foreign direct investment in the United States position grew 5.3 percent after growing 5.8 percent.

row.Title: Annual Revision of the U.S. International Transactions Accounts
row.Author: C. Omar Kebbeh, Cavan Wilk
row.Description: Quarterly and annual statistics were revised to incorporate a variety of enhancements, including newly available and revised source data, updated seasonal factors and more.

row.Title: U.S. International Transactions: First Quarter of 2015
row.Author: William J. Zeile
row.Description: The current-account deficit increased $10.2 billion to $113.3 billion. In the financial account, net U.S. borrowing increased $0.1 billion to $47.9 billion.

row.Title: International Transactions and Positions in Financial Derivatives Other Than Reserves
row.Description: Statistics on transactions and positions in financial derivatives by type of contract and by area for 2012–2014 and for the first quarter of 2013 through the first quarter of 2015.
row.Category: International, International transactions and positions in financial derivatives other than reserves

row.Title: How BEA Aligns and Augments Source Data From the U.S. Treasury Department for Inclusion in the International Transactions Accounts
row.Description: The estimates of financial-account flows in these accounts, which are based on Treasury Department data, are adjusted to align the estimates with balance-of-payments concepts and to close gaps in coverage.

row.Title: Real Per Capita Personal Income and Regional Price Parities for 2013
row.Author: Bettina H. Aten, Eric B. Figueroa, Bryan M. Vengelen
row.Description: In 2013, the change in real personal income ranged from 3.5 percent in Iowa to –4.4 percent in North Dakota. In metropolitan areas, the change in personal income ranged from 4.8 percent in Sioux City, IA-NE-SD, to –3.1 percent in New Bern, NC.

row.Title: Regional Quarterly Report
row.Author: David G. Lenze
row.Description: State personal income growth slowed in 25 states in the first quarter of 2015 and accelerated in 15 states. Personal income declined in four states. On average, personal income grew 0.9 percent in the first quarter, compared with 1.1 percent in the fourth quarter of 2014.

row.Title: Gross Domestic Product by State: Advance Statistics for 2014 and Revised Statistics for 1997–2013
row.Author: John E. Broda, Robert P. Tate
row.Description: Real GDP by state increased in 48 states and the District of Columbia and in all eight regions in 2014. Texas was the fastest growing state at 5.2 percent. The Southwest region was the fastest growing region at 4.3 percent.
row.Category: Regional, Gross domestic product by state

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: Brian C. Moyer
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Brian C. Moyer

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: BEA paper calculates medical care expenditure price indexes for more years

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Advance Estimates for the Second Quarter of 2015
row.Author: Lisa S. Mataloni
row.Description: Real GDP increased 2.3 percent after increasing 0.6 percent in the first quarter of 2015. The second-quarter increase reflected contributions from consumer spending, exports, state and local government spending, and residential investment.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: The 2015 Annual Revision of the National Income and Product Accounts
row.Author: Stephanie H. McCulla, Shelly Smith
row.Description: Details of the annual revision, which incorporated newly available and revised source data and new methods and presentations.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Activities of U.S. Multinational Enterprises in 2013
row.Author: Sarah P. Scott
row.Description: The current-dollar value added of U.S. multinational enterprises rose 4.0 percent in 2013 after rising 1.9 percent in 2012. Employment increased 1.4 percent after increasing 1.1 percent.

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: Brian C. Moyer
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Brian C. Moyer

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: Now available: primer on capital stocks and new statistics on U.S. multinational enterprises

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Second Estimates for the Second Quarter of 2015
row.Author: Lisa S. Mataloni
row.Description: Real GDP increased 3.7 percent after increasing 0.6 percent in the first quarter of 2015. The second-quarter increase reflected contributions from consumer spending, exports, state and local government spending, and residential investment.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Government Receipts and Expenditures: Second Quarter of 2015
row.Author: Mary L. Roy
row.Description: Net government saving decreased $16.1 billion to –$745.8 billion. Net federal government saving decreased $14.3 billion to –$593.6 billion. Net state and local government saving decreased $1.8 billion to –$152.2 billion.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Integrated Industry-Level Production Account for the United States Update
row.Author: Mark Dumas, Thomas F. Howells III, Steve Rosenthal, Jon D. Samuels
row.Description: New industry-level statistics for 2013 can be used to analyze the underlying trends in aggregate economic growth.

row.Title: Supply-Use Tables for the United States
row.Author: Jeffrey A. Young, Thomas F. Howells III, Erich H. Strassner, David B. Wasshausen
row.Description: An addition to the industry economic accounts, these new tables will provide an integrated presentation of the total domestic supply of goods and services from both domestic and foreign producers and the use of this supply across the U.S. economy.

row.Title: U.S. Direct Investment Abroad for 2012–2014: Detailed Historical-Cost Positions and Related Financial Transactions and Income Flows
row.Author: Nathan R. Hansen, Ricardo Limés
row.Description: Detailed statistics on a directional basis by country and by industry.

row.Title: Foreign Direct Investment in the United States for 2012–2014: Detailed Historical-Cost Positions and Related Financial Transactions and Income Flows
row.Author: Nathan R. Hansen, Ricardo Limés
row.Description: Detailed statistics on a directional basis by country and by industry.
row.Category: International, Foreign direct investment in the United States

row.Title: Gross Domestic Product by State: Prototype Quarterly Statistics for 2005–2014
row.Author: Charles Ian Mead
row.Description: These new statistics are intended to provide more precise and timely information on the accelerations, decelerations, and turning points in state-level economic activity, including changes in the industrial infrastructure of states.
row.Category: Regional, Gross domestic product by state

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: Brian C. Moyer
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Brian C. Moyer

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: BEA paper suggests a new concept of multinational enterprises for the System of National Accounts 2008

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Third Estimates for the Second Quarter of 2015
row.Author: Lisa S. Mataloni
row.Description: Real GDP increased 3.9 percent after increasing 0.6 percent in the first quarter of 2015. The second-quarter increase reflected a notable contribution from consumer spending.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: U.S. International Services: Trade in Services in 2014 and Services Supplied Through Affiliates in 2013
row.Author: Alexis N. Grimm, Charu S. Krishnan
row.Description: In 2014, the U.S. surplus on the trade in services was $233.1 billion. In 2013, services supplied to foreign markets by the foreign affiliates of U.S. multinationals enterprises exceeded services supplied to U.S. markets by the U.S. affiliates of foreign multinational enterprises.

row.Title: U.S. International Transactions: Second Quarter of 2015
row.Author: William J. Zeile
row.Description: The current-account deficit decreased $8.6 billion to $109.7 billion. In the financial account, net U.S. borrowing decreased $0.6 billion to $59.7 billion.

row.Title: The U.S. Net International Investment Position at the End of the Second Quarter of 2015
row.Author: Kyle L. Westmoreland
row.Description: The net international investment position was –$6,688.3 billion at the end of the second quarter of 2015; at the end of the first quarter of 2015, the net position was –$6,801.4 billion.

row.Title: Annual Revision of Gross Domestic Product by Metropolitan Area: Advance Statistics for 2014 and Revised Statistics for 2001–2013
row.Author: Frank T. Baumgardner, Sharon D. Panek, Ralph M. Rodriguez
row.Description: Real GDP increased in 282 of the nation's 381 metropolitan areas in 2014. Real GDP for metropolitan areas in the United States increased 2.3 percent in 2014 after increasing 1.9 percent in 2013.
row.Category: Regional, Gross domestic product by metropolitan area

row.Title: Regional Quarterly Report
row.Author: David G. Lenze
row.Description: State personal income grew on average 0.9 percent in the second quarter of 2015, up from 0.8 percent in the first quarter. Detailed annual statistics for 2014 are also presented.

row.Title: BEA News Release Schedule for 2016
Director's Message
row.Author: Brian C. Moyer
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Brian C. Moyer

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: BEA economists look at nursing home care inflation

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Advance Estimates for the Third Quarter of 2015
row.Author: Lisa S. Mataloni
row.Description: Real GDP increased 1.5 percent after increasing 3.9 percent in the second quarter. The third-quarter increase reflected increases in consumer spending, state and local government spending, business investment, exports, and residential investment.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Updated Summary of NIPA Methodologies
row.Description: The data and methods used to prepare current-dollar and real gross domestic product and current-dollar gross domestic income, reflecting the 2015 annual NIPA revision.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Disease-Based Health Care Measures and the Industry Economic Accounts
row.Author: Patricia A. Washington, Daniel W. Jackson, David B. Wasshausen
row.Description: The BEA health care satellite account included experimental disease-based measures for the industry economic accounts (IEA). This article updates these measures to include 2011 and 2012 and discusses future statistical products to be based on the IEA framework.

row.Title: Activities of U.S. Affiliates of Foreign Multinational Enterprises
row.Author: Rita Ismaylov, Ricardo Limés
row.Description: The current-dollar value added of majority-owned U.S. affiliates rose 5.5 percent to $835.6 billion. Employment by these affiliates increased 3.6 percent to 6.1 million workers.
row.Category: International, Foreign direct investment in the United States

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: Brian C. Moyer
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Brian C. Moyer

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: A new analysis of regional med-tech utilization

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Second Estimates for the Third Quarter of 2015
row.Author: Lisa S. Mataloni
row.Description: Real GDP increased 2.1 percent after increasing 3.9 percent in the second quarter. The third-quarter increase reflected increases in consumer spending, nonresidential fixed investment, state and local government spending, residential investment, and exports.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Government Receipts and Expenditures: Third Quarter of 2015
row.Author: Michelle S. Grier
row.Description: Net government saving decreased $24.4 billion to –$753.1 billion. Net federal government saving decreased $23.0 billion to –$597.2 billion. Net state and local government saving decreased $1.3 billion to –$155.8 billion.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: The 2015 Annual Revision of the Industry Economic Accounts: Initial Statistics for the Second Quarter of 2015 and Revised Statistics for 2012–2014 and the First Quarter of 2015
row.Author: Kevin B. Barefoot, Edward T. Morgan, Ksenia E. Shadrina
row.Description: Economic growth was widespread in the second quarter of 2015; 18 of the 22 major industry groups contributed to the 3.9 percent growth in real GDP.

row.Title: Local Area Personal Income for 2014
row.Author: David G. Lenze
row.Description: Personal income grew 4.6 percent in the metropolitan portion of the United States in 2014. In the nonmetropolitan portion, it grew 3.2 percent.

row.Title: Personal Consumption Expenditures by State for 1997–2014
row.Author: Christian Awuku-Budu, Mahsa Agha Gholizadeh, Ledia Guci, Christopher A. Lucas
row.Description: Growth in PCE by state in 2014 ranged from 2.1 percent in West Virginia to 7.4 percent in North Dakota. Across all states, total growth in PCE by state was 4.2 percent in 2014, up from 3.1 percent in 2013.
row.Category: Regional, Personal consumption expenditures by state

row.Title: Subject Guide
row.Description: A list of the articles in the Survey of Current Business in 2015.

row.Title: Schedule of BEA News Releases in 2016
